Package ciberIF

Class ciberIF

  • java.lang.Object
    • ciberIF.ciberIF
  • public class ciberIF
extends java.lang.Object
    provides the interface with the simulator, all types of communication with the simulator may be realized using methods of this class

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      ciberIF()
      ciberIF contructor The constructor inits all necessary data structures,

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void DriveMotors​(double lPow, double rPow)
      drive left motor with lPow and right motor with rPow, powers are in (-0.15, 0.15)
      void Finish()
      finish the round
      beaconMeasure GetBeaconSensor​(int id)
      get beacon sensor measure, value is the direction of beacon in robot coordinates (-180.0,180.0)
      boolean GetBumperSensor()
      get bumper sensor measure, active when robot collides
      double GetCompassSensor()
      get compass sensor measure, value is the direction of robot in ground coordinates (-180.0,180.0)
      int GetCycleTime()
      read parameter settings
      double GetDir()
      get robot orientation of current position from GPS sensor, can be used for debug, invoke simulator with '-gps' option
      int GetFinalTime()
      read parameter settings
      boolean GetFinished()
      get end led state, usefull to verify if Finished() was executed in the simulator

      get ground sensor measure, active when in target area

      get obstacle sensor measure, value is inversely proportional to nearest obstacle distance

    • Method Detail

      • InitRobot

        public boolean InitRobot​(java.lang.String name,
                         int pos,
                         java.lang.String hostname)
        Initializes Robot and Connects to Simulator
        Parameters:
        name - robot name
        pos - initial position of robot in initial grid
        hostname - host where simulator running

      • InitRobot2

        public boolean InitRobot2​(java.lang.String name,
                          int pos,
                          double[] IRSensorAngles,
                          java.lang.String hostname)
        Initializes Robot and Connects to Simulator, allows specification of obstacle sensors position
        Parameters:
        name - robot name
        pos - initial position of robot in initial grid
        IRSensorAngles - array of doubles that specifies position of IR sensors, positions are given from angle (in degrees) from front of Robot
        hostname - host where simulator running

      • ReadSensors

        public void ReadSensors()
        Read a message from simulator. If no message is available wait, when message arrives parses it. This is the main synchronization method of this library.

      • GetTime

        public double GetTime()
        get simulation time of last received message

      • IsObstacleReady

        public boolean IsObstacleReady​(int id)
        Indicates if a new Obstacle measure from sensor id has arrived.\ The value of GetObstacleSensor is invalid when IsObstacleReady returns false

      • GetObstacleSensor

        public double GetObstacleSensor​(int id)
        get obstacle sensor measure, value is inversely proportional to nearest obstacle distance

      • IsBeaconReady

        public boolean IsBeaconReady​(int id)
        only when IsBeaconReady returns true is the beacon measure significative

      • GetBeaconSensor

        public beaconMeasure GetBeaconSensor​(int id)
        get beacon sensor measure, value is the direction of beacon in robot coordinates (-180.0,180.0)

        public boolean IsCompassReady()
